prompt:
# SQL Query Generator
This system converts natural language questions into SQL queries.

## Database Schema
- users (id, name, email, created_at)
- products (id, name, description, price, category_id)
- categories (id, name)
- orders (id, user_id, created_at, total_amount)
- order_items (id, order_id, product_id, quantity, unit_price)

## Guidelines
- Use proper JOIN syntax for table relationships
- Include WHERE clauses for filtering
- Order results appropriately with ORDER BY
- Use aggregation functions (COUNT, SUM, AVG) when needed
- Return only the SQL query, nothing else
